definition: to spin silk
to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc
lit. to spin silk from cocoons/fig. to make a painstaking investigation (idiom)
sickness comes like a landslide, but goes slowly like spinning silk (idiom); expect to convalesce slowly
pinyin: bing4 lai2 ru2 shan1 dao3 , bing4 qu4 ru2 chou1 si1
containing_words.word: 病來如山倒，病去如抽絲

sentences.english: Have you any nylon that won't ladder ?
sentences.chinese: 你有不會抽絲的尼龍襪子嗎？

sentences.english: Diseases come on horseback, but go away on foot.
sentences.chinese: 病來如山倒，病去如抽絲。

sentences.english: Aqiao learned how to reel silk and how to dye it.
sentences.chinese: 阿巧學會了如何抽絲和給絲染色。

sentences.english: Write well, pare chrysalis reel off raw silk from cocoons, expect sequel Write very carefully, suffer taught.
sentences.chinese: 寫得不錯，剝繭抽絲，期待後續寫得很仔細，受教了。

sentences.english: Her stocking had a ladder in it.
sentences.chinese: 她的長襪有一道抽絲痕。

sentences.english: The product was used to do the melt spun test directly and the fiber of the HMWPPS was obtained.
sentences.chinese: 產品直接作抽絲試驗，得到高分子量聚苯硫醚纖維。

sentences.english: It is annoying when stockings ladder.
sentences.chinese: 長統襪抽絲時真叫人掃興。

sentences.english: I cooked the syrup until it threaded.
sentences.chinese: 我將糖漿熬到能抽絲爲止。

sentences.english: In investigating a process, yang Jiaming gradually reel off raw silk from cocoons pares chrysalis, find really fierce.
sentences.chinese: 在調查過程中，楊家明逐漸抽絲剝繭，找到真兇。

sentences.english: She has a run in her stocking.
Do you have socks not laddering.
sentences.chinese: 你有沒有不抽絲的襪子？

sentences.english: Her stockings were always laddered after work.
sentences.chinese: 她的長筒襪經常在工作後出現抽絲。

sentences.english: As "ill come on horseback, but go away on foot."
sentences.chinese: 常言道“病來如山倒，病去如抽絲”。

root of Chinese pulsatilla/Chinese bulbul
(of spiders, caterpillars, silkworms etc) to extrude silk
rattan
nib/pen point/the tip of a writing brush or pencil
spoken language/sound of speaking
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to shake/to sway
to swallow in one gulp (idiom)/(fig.) to accept without thinking/to lap up
lit. moving clouds and flowing water (idiom)/fig. very natural and flowing style of calligraphy, writing, etc/natural and unforced
string/thread
to chat with a low voice
thin paper (tissue paper, onionskin etc)
gossamer/hairspring
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
